text: today's recipe is a little bit fancy
it's a hazelnut shortbread you make a
shortbread crust and then you top with a
hazelnut caramel it's a lot easier than
it sounds to start off with you make
your shortbread crust in the bowl of
this mixer I have a stick of butter and
1/3 of a cup of light brown sugar cream
those two together I'm really into these
shortbread crust because they're really
simple but they add a lot of great
flavor to cookie bars your butter is
very soft it shouldn't take very long at
all for it to get creamed make sure that
you scrape down your bowl to make sure
that it's all fully combined once
everything is light its a cup and a half
of all-purpose flour
probably easier if you lift up the head
if you have the tilt and then a quarter
teaspoon of fine salt if you happen to
have coarse salt just use a half a
teaspoon
beat to combine and then have an 8x8
baking dish buttered and then lined with
parchment with overhangs on either side
and this will make it easier to remove
my hazelnut bars you want to beat this
until clumps form which I can see are
forming now have your oven preheating to
375 degrees sometimes I like to take it
off the mixer and give just one or two
more stirs so that any butter that's
caught on the bottom gets fully combined
before you start pressing it into the
pan pour it in you might want to lightly
flour your hands to press your dough
into the pan you can also use the bottom
of a dry measure if you want to do that
and make sure it's nice and even work so
much better than your hands for a nice
evenly packed crust get this into a 375
degree oven and bake it until it's set
and light golden brown that'll take
about 20 minutes when the crust comes
out of the oven you want to let it cool
for about 15 minutes and after you take
it out reduce your oven temperature to
325 because there's a secondary cooking
of this recipe I have a stick of butter
in this pot using my handy dandy
induction burner to that add a third of
a cup of corn syrup it's the light
corn syrup two tablespoons of cream 1/4
teaspoon of fine salt two thirds of a
cup of light brown sugar and then just
bring all of this together up to a boil
it's coming to a boil these induction
burners are fast you want to make sure
that it fully boils on top of your stove
for one minute that smells good
after mixture is boiled for a minute add
your hazelnuts this is one and a half
cups of toasted hazelnuts that skins
have been rubbed off don't be too anal
about it it doesn't have to be perfect
perfect and if you wanted to replace the
hazelnuts with another kind of nut go
ahead use pecans use almonds whatever
you want then you pour it over your
crusts that's been cooling for about 15
minutes and then this needs to bake a
further about 15 minutes it needs to be
fully bubbling in the center so check
and if it's not bubbling don't take it
out because it won't be done 325 degrees
and then if you want to you can take it
out and sprinkle some chocolate about a
third of a cup over the top and then
just throw it back in the oven until the
chocolate melts when the hazelnut bars
come out of the oven you want to let
them cool in the pan for about an hour
just so they're pretty firm then remove
it and cool it completely in the
refrigerator so that it's completely
completely set then just cut it into
pieces you can give it away as gifts if
you want to look at that it looks so
special but it's really super duper easy
to make
chewie nutty fantastic
you
